Html:
Hello,
we have depoly adobe reader 11.0.6 for few months with a mst file.
For a new days we have done some changes in the mst file.

Now we search a method to deploy the new mst file. I don't found a function like "reinstall".
How did you solved the problem?

Hi,

you can deploy the Registry Settings with Group Policy Preferences. I think it is the easiest way in this case.
Since Version 11 Adobe will provide ADMX-Files for creating GPOs.

Hi,
the admx file contains only a few options.
I don't found the registry key to set protection view -> off.

Here you will find a Solution:

http://forums.adobe.com/message/4920455

http://www.adobe.com/devnet-docs/acrobatetk/tools/AppSec/protectedmode.html

http://www.faq-o-matic.net/2010/11/23/terminalserver-den-protected-mode-des-adobe-reader-x-abschalten/

We have decided to uninstall the complete Adobe Reader and install it again with the mst file.
I read your links, but i don't found the right way.

badwurzach wrote:
I read your links, but i don't found the right way.
Hmm, you can use ProcessMonitor from Sysinterals to see which registry keys/settings will be changed if you set in the GUI some settings.
To late... we have done a complete reinstall of it.
